TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national born in DATE and residing in PERSON , the region of Vratsa .
The facts of the case as submitted by the parties may be summarised as follows .
A.
CARDINAL . Background

On an unspecified date in DATE , prior to the events in the present case , criminal proceedings were opened against the applicant and CARDINAL other persons on charges that they had robbed PERSON in her presence , taking away CARDINAL fur coats and some other objects . The applicant was detained on remand between DATE and CARDINAL DATE when he was released on bail . As of DATE the case was pending for trial , a hearing having been fixed for DATE .

On DATE in the area of the village PERSON CARDINAL persons were shot and killed in their car in what was seen as an internal war between local criminal groups . According to the indictment the applicant and a Mr G. were in a car which was chased by the victims . At some point the CARDINAL cars stopped , and the applicant , who had bought an automatic gun DATE before the events , went out and fired the gun to kill all the victims , one after another . At his trial the applicant stated that he was present during the killings but that it had been PERSON who had shot the victims .
CARDINAL . The preliminary investigation
The applicant did not return home after the above events . On DATE he voluntarily appeared at the police in GPE where he was arrested and transferred to Vratsa .

On DATE or DATE an investigator ( следовател ) officially charged the applicant on CARDINAL counts of murder and ordered his detention on remand . On DATE or DATE this decision was confirmed by a prosecutor .

DATE the investigator in the applicant ’s case heard CARDINAL witnesses and CARDINAL medical , ballistic and other experts . Some of the witnesses were examined upon the request of the applicant ’s lawyer of CARDINAL DATE . The investigator also made site visits and conducted an experiment , reconstructing the events of DATE . The investigator heard the applicant on CARDINAL occasions during this period of time . He also collected other documentary evidence .
On DATE the investigator requested the competent prosecutor to authorise the continuation of the investigation for DATE . By decision of DATE ORG ( окръжна прокуратура ) granted the request .
On DATE the investigator appointed a psychiatric expert to examine the applicant . An expert in physics and chemistry was appointed on DATE to analyse traces of gunpowder .

The investigator examined the applicant again on DATE . The applicant requested the collection of additional evidence . On CARDINAL DATE the investigator appointed an expert in graphology . On DATE ORG ( главна прокуратура ) authorised the continuation of the preliminary investigation . On DATE the investigator dealt with the applicant ’s requests in relation to the collection of evidence in his case .

On DATE the investigator completed his work on the case and sent it to ORG . On DATE ORG returned the case for further investigation with instructions to charge the applicant also with unlawful possession of arms .

On DATE the investigator wrote a letter to ORG in Vratsa explaining that the applicant insisted on the presence of his lawyer during the investigation and that the lawyer , who was from GPE , had declined to come to PERSON on several proposed dates . Finally the lawyer had agreed to come on CARDINAL or CARDINAL February CARDINAL .
The additional preliminary investigation was concluded on DATE . On DATE ORG submitted an indictment to ORG in Vratsa .

By decision of DATE ORG fixed a hearing for DATE . At the hearing on CARDINAL DATE the applicant claimed that there had been breaches of procedure and requested that the case be referred for further preliminary investigation . The ORG found that there had been procedural violations which necessitated the referral of the case back to the prosecutor . On DATE the prosecutor returned the case to the investigator .
On DATE the ORG refused the applicant ’s request for the replacement of the investigator .
On DATE the investigator examined CARDINAL witness . On DATE the investigator allowed CARDINAL civil plaintiffs to consult the case - file .
On DATE the applicant was examined by the investigator . On DATE the investigator completed his work on the case and sent it to ORG . On DATE a new indictment was submitted to ORG .

During the preliminary investigation stage of the proceedings the applicant , who was legally represented , submitted to the investigator and to the prosecution authorities numerous complaints and requests . He complained of the behaviour of the investigator , about the visit arrangements in prison , about the delays in the examination of his case , requested his release and raised other matters .
CARDINAL . The trial
By decision of DATE the ORG fixed a hearing for CARDINAL , DATE and DATE DATE . On DATE the ORG inquired with the competent administrative authorities about the address of a witness .

On DATE and DATE , at the hearing , the ORG admitted for joint examination CARDINAL civil claims submitted by relatives of the victims , heard the applicant and CARDINAL witnesses . Some of the witnesses refused to answer certain questions . Counsel for the applicant requested the collection of additional evidence .

The hearing was adjourned until DATE when the court heard CARDINAL witnesses and CARDINAL experts . The ORG again adjourned the hearing because of the failure of certain witnesses to appear and also in view of the request supported by the applicant ’s lawyer for the appointment ballistic experts . This was apparently related to the divergence in the testimonies given by the applicant and PERSON The applicant claimed inter alia that PERSON had shot one of the victims during the chase , at a moment when the cars had still been in motion , whereas PERSON claimed that the applicant had shot all the victims from a static position .

The hearing resumed on DATE when the ORG heard the applicant , the experts and CARDINAL witnesses . The ORG adjourned the hearing as CARDINAL witnesses had not appeared . A warrant for the arrest of CARDINAL of them had been issued , but his whereabouts had remained unknown .
On DATE , acting in camera , the ORG ordered the admission in evidence of several objects .
The hearing resumed on DATE . At that hearing PERSON partially altered his testimony . The ORG adjourned the hearing until DATE .
By letter of DATE the applicant requested the examination of CARDINAL additional witnesses . On DATE he requested to be examined with the use of a “ lie - detector ” . This request was refused .

On DATE , at the resumed hearing , the ORG heard a police officer who participated at the applicant ’s questioning during DATE after his detention and a shepherd , who was an eye - witness of the events . The applicant also gave additional testimony . CARDINAL other witnesses did not appear , the efforts to locate CARDINAL of them having been fruitless .

ORG decided that the questioning of CARDINAL of the witnesses which had not appeared was essential and listed the case for a hearing on DATE . The ORG also accepted the request of the prosecution for the questioning of an anonymous witness .

On DATE the hearing was adjourned until CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE as the prosecutor had fallen ill and also because he had been unable to secure the attendance of the anonymous witness requested by him .

In DATE Mr G , the witness who had been with the applicant during the shooting on DATE , was murdered . According to the applicant , in whose submission PERSON was the person who had shot the CARDINAL victims on DATE , PERSON found his death when he visited another witness with the intention to threaten him . The Government have not commented .

On DATE the ORG heard one anonymous witness and another witness . The anonymous witness stated , inter alia , that he feared for his life and declined to name certain persons in his testimony . The applicant submits he has discovered the identity of the anonymous witness .

The other witness who testified on DATE altered his testimony given at the preliminary investigation , explaining that his previous version of the facts had been dictated to him by PERSON who had threatened him and beaten him on two occasions in DATE .

At the close of the hearing the applicant ’s lawyer and the civil plaintiffs requested the examination of additional witnesses . The ORG granted these requests and adjourned the hearing until DATE and DATE , when it was again adjourned . The parties have not substantiated whether the ORG examined any evidence at the hearing on CARDINAL and DATE .

The hearing resumed on DATE . On that date the trial re - commenced as one of the lay judges had passed away and no reserve lay judge had been appointed . On CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE the new composition of ORG examined several witnesses and adjourned the hearing .
CARDINAL . Decisions on the continuation of the applicant ’s detention

Following the applicant ’s detention on remand on DATE and until the first indictment his detention was confirmed by ORG and by ORG by decisions dated DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . The decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE stated that there was a danger of absconding , obstructing justice and re - offending . The decision of DATE stated that there were no grounds justifying release . The parties have not substantiated the reasoning of the remaining decisions .

On DATE a judge at ORG confirmed the applicant ’s detention . Following the referral of the case back to the prosecution authorities , the detention was confirmed by their decisions of DATE , DATE and DATE . The decision of CARDINAL DATE did not contain any reasoning . The decision of DATE stated that the applicant ’s request to be released for lack of sufficient proof against him was unfounded as his detention was in conformity with LAW . The reasoning of the decisions of DATE and DATE has not been substantiated .

During the applicant ’s trial his detention on remand was confirmed by ORG on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , and DATE . The decision of CARDINAL DATE was in the form of a letter which informed the applicant that his detention was lawful as he was detained by decision of ORG , which had been subject to appeal . The decision of DATE stated that the applicant could not be released in view of the charges against him . The decision of CARDINAL DATE stated that the new legislation referred to by the applicant concerned only time - limits on pre - trial detention and was therefore inapplicable . ORG further stated that in the case before it the accusation concerned a serious wilful crime and that therefore there were no grounds for release on bail . The reasoning of the remaining decisions confirming the applicant ’s detention has not been substantiated .

Some of the above decisions were taken ex officio whereas others were in response to the applicant ’s requests for release . During the preliminary - investigation stage of the proceedings he applied for release at least in DATE , and in DATE , DATE and DATE . Following the commencement of the trial in DATE the applicant requested his release in DATE , in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and in DATE . The parties have not substantiated the decisions taken on the latter CARDINAL requests .
The minutes of the hearing of DATE record the following words of the applicant ’s lawyer :

“ In this respect I would request that ... PERSON ... be summoned as a witness . I would ask for his summoning through the district police . I would ask for leave to submit later the exact address of this witness . I make all these requests after consultation with my client . With a view to avoid any suspicion about manipulation on his part , he wishes to underline that he does not insist on [ release ] and for that reason asks that the witnesses be summoned [ by the court ] . ”
B. Relevant domestic law and practice
Provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( Наказателно процесуален кодекс ) , as in force at the relevant time :
Section CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL , as in force until DATE , provided as follows :
" ( CARDINAL ) Detention on remand shall be imposed [ in cases where the charges concern ] crimes punishable by CARDINAL or more years’ imprisonment or capital punishment .
( CARDINAL ) In the cases under the preceding paragraph [ detention on remand ] shall not be imposed if there is no danger of the accused evading justice or of committing another crime ... "
Section CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL , as in force after DATE , provide as follows :
" ( CARDINAL ) Detention on remand shall be imposed [ in cases where the charges concern ] a serious wilful crime .

( CARDINAL ) In the cases referred to in paragraph CARDINAL [ detention on remand ] may not be imposed if there is no danger of the accused evading justice , obstructing the investigation , or committing another crime . ”
According to LAW of LAW ( NORP кодекс ) " serious " is a crime punishable by PERCENT DATE imprisonment .
The relevant part of LAW and DATE , as in force between CARDINAL DATE and DATE , provided as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) LAW shall not apply where other criminal proceedings for [ a publicly prosecuted ] crime are pending against the accused person , or where [ the accused is a recidivist ] ...
( CARDINAL ) The detained person shall immediately be provided with the opportunity to file an appeal to the competent court against his [ detention on remand ] ... "

In DATE the text of paragraph CARDINAL of LAW was replaced by a provision limiting the length of pre - trial detention . These limits do not apply in respect of detention after the commencement of the trial .
